# spacelift_plugin (Resource)

`spacelift_plugin` represents a Spacelift **plugin** - an instance of a plugin template that can be used to extend Spacelift functionality.

## Example Usage

```terraform
data "spacelift_plugin_template" "opentofu_tracing" {
  plugin_template_id = "opentofu-tracing"
}

resource "spacelift_plugin" "opentofu_tracing" {
  plugin_template_id = data.spacelift_plugin_template.opentofu_tracing.id
  name               = "OpenTofu Tracing Plugin"
  stack_label        = "tracing"
  parameters = {
    output_file = "tracing_output.md"
  }
}
```

<!-- schema generated by tfplugindocs -->
## Schema

### Required

- `name` (String) Name of the plugin
- `plugin_template_id` (String) ID of the plugin template to use
- `stack_label` (String) Label to use when attaching the plugin to stacks

### Optional

- `labels` (Set of String) Labels to apply to the plugin
- `parameters` (Map of String, Sensitive) Map of parameter ids to values.
- `space_id` (String) ID of the space the plugin is in

### Read-Only

- `id` (String) Immutable ID of the plugin

## Import

Import is supported using the following syntax:

The [`terraform import` command](https://developer.hashicorp.com/terraform/cli/commands/import) can be used, for example:

```shell
# Note: Importing plugins with parameters will cause the plugin to be recreated.
# We recommend using a lifecycle rule to ignore parameters if imported.

tofu import spacelift_plugin.opentofu_tracing $PLUGIN_ID
```
